body.p: The structure of different muscle fiber types allows them to perform specific functions. Extrapolate from the description what function these structures would lend themselves to.
These fibers contain a lot of mitochondria so that they can:

response.feedback: Incorrect. Anaerobic respiration occurs in the cytoplasm and produces less energy than is possible with the mitochondria.
Correct. The more mitochondria you have the more oxygen you can use to combine with glucose to make energy.
Incorrect. glycolysis occurs in the cytoplasm and produces less energy than is possible with the mitochondria.
Incorrect. Fermentation occurs in the cytoplasm and produces less energy than is possible with the mitochondria.

part.hint: Mitochondria are the location of a specific type of respiration that produces the most ATP.

question.body: These fibers have a relatively small diameters so they:

multiple_choice.choice: can produce less tension but contract for a longer period of time.
can produce more tension and contract for longer period of time.
can produce more tension and contract for a shorter period of time.
can produce less tension but contract for a shorter period of time.

response.feedback: Correct. Smaller diameter decreases the tension and increases how long it takes the muscle to fatigue.
Incorrect. The smaller diameter decreases the amount of tension.
Incorrect. The smaller diameter decreases the amount of tension and increases how long it takes the muscle to fatigue.
Incorrect. The smaller diameter increases how long it takes the muscle to fatigue.

part.hint: These fibers are slow twitch fibers.

question.body: These fibers have a large blood supply and myoglobin in them so they can:

multiple_choice.choice: Have enough carbon dioxide to enable anaerobic metabolism.
Have enough oxygen to enable anaerobic metabolism.
Have enough carbon dioxide to enable aerobic metabolism.
Have enough oxygen to enable aerobic metabolism.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Carbon dioxide can be produces by anaerbic respiration but is not required for it.
Incorrect. anaerobic metabolism occurs in the absence of oxygen.
Incorrect. Oxygen is required from aerobic metabolism, not carbon dioxide.
Correct. Myoglobin contains oxygen which can be used for aerobic respiration.

part.hint: Anaerobic metabolism does not require oxygen.

question.body: If we combine the functions of all these structures together we get a fiber that can create a lot of energy aerobically and sustain low tension contractions for a long period of time. This type of fiber is a:

response.feedback: Correct. Slow oxidative fibers have all of these characteristics.
Incorrect. Fast oxidative have some of these characteristics but have intermediate fatigue resistance.
Incorrect. Fast glycolytic produce high amounts of tension for short amounts of time.
Incorrect. There is not a fiber that has this name.

part.hint: Think of which process requires more oxidation.
